title: How to Make a Belgian Chocolate Layer Cake

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 180ºC or 350ºF.

text: Preheat the oven to 180ºC or 350ºF. Line two 23 centimeter (9.1 in) cake tins with greaseproof paper. Beat the softened butter with the sugar, then add eggs one at a time, mixing well between each one.  Mix together the flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, vanilla extract and ground almonds, then add to egg mixture and 1/2 cup of boiling water and blend well.  Pour even amounts of the mixture into the two cake tins, and bake until they are just set in the middle. (30 - 40 minutes) Cool the cakes. Melt the butter and chocolate for the filling over a pan of hot water.  Beat the egg with the icing sugar then mix on the melted chocolate mixture.  Sandwich the two cakes together with the mixture.  Finished.
